label: ABC8D2_mP24_13_e_f_4g_g-001
title: NaIn(WO$_{4}$)$_{2}$ Structure
comments:
This structure is related to \href{current_web_home_dir/AB4C_mP12_13_e_2g_f-003}{huanzalaite, MgWO$_{4}$ ($H0_{6}$)}, an ordered wolframite structure. 
 Space group $P2/c$ \#13 allows an arbitrary angle $\beta$ between the $a_{1}$ and $a_{3}$ primitive lattice vectors.  (Klevtsov, 1970) state that $\beta = 90^{\circ} \pm 0.5^{\circ}$ for all the compounds they studied, and the distances they give between atoms is consistent with $\beta = 90^{\circ}$.  Nevertheless, it is likely that $\beta$ is not exactly a right angle.  In huanzalaite, {\em e.g.}, $\beta = 90.3^{\circ}$.
